intro: Silene pusilla var. pudibunda, commonly known as the blushing pink or the modest pink, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early summer, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and the plant is known for its modest appearance and ability to thrive in harsh alpine conditions. Silene pusilla var. pudibunda is also noted for its short stature, rarely exceeding a few inches in height.
